dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.
dependencies.name: perl

dependencies.description: XML::Parser - A perl module for parsing XML documents
dependencies.name: perl-xml-parser

dependent_to.description: Dia is a program for drawing structured diagrams.
dependent_to.name: dia

dependent_to.description: Helper applications for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: exo

dependent_to.description: Menu library for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: garcon

dependent_to.description:
GConf is a system for storing application preferences. Note that this
software is now deprecated in favor of moving to GSettings and dconf
with the GNOME 3 transition.
dependent_to.name: gconf

dependent_to.description:
GIMP is a cross-platform image editor available for GNU/Linux, macOS,
Windows and more operating systems. It is free software, you can change
its source code and distribute your changes. Whether you are a graphic
designer, photographer, illustrator, or scientist, GIMP provides you
with sophisticated tools to get your job done. You can further enhance
your productivity with GIMP thanks to many customization options and 3rd
party plugins.
dependent_to.name: gimp

dependent_to.description:
GtkSourceView is a GNOME library that extends GtkTextView, the standard
GTK+ widget for multiline text editing. GtkSourceView adds support for
syntax highlighting, undo/redo, file loading and saving, search and
replace, a completion system, printing, displaying line numbers, and
other features typical of a source code editor.
dependent_to.name: gtksourceview

dependent_to.description:
libmypaint - MyPaint brush engine library. This is the brush library
used by MyPaint. A number of other painting programs use it too.
dependent_to.name: libmypaint

dependent_to.description: Window Navigator Construction Kit
dependent_to.name: libwnck

dependent_to.description: Widget sharing library for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: libxfce4ui

dependent_to.description: Libxfce4util common non-GTK+ utilities among the Xfce applications.
dependent_to.name: libxfce4util

dependent_to.description: Database of common MIME types.
dependent_to.name: shared-mime-info

dependent_to.description: Thunar File Manager
dependent_to.name: thunar

dependent_to.description:
Thunar extension which enables automatic management of removable drives
and media.
dependent_to.name: thunar-volman

dependent_to.description:
Tumbler is a D-Bus service for applications to request thumbnails for
XFCE4
dependent_to.name: tumbler

dependent_to.description: Program to find and launch installed applications for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: xfce4-appfinder

dependent_to.description: Panel manager for Xfce4
dependent_to.name: xfce4-panel

dependent_to.description: Session manager for Xfce4
dependent_to.name: xfce4-session

dependent_to.description:
Daemon, manager, and editor to centralize the configuration management
for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: xfce4-settings

dependent_to.description: xfconf - Configuration Storage System for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: xfconf

dependent_to.description: Xfdesktop is a desktop manager for the Xfce Desktop Environment.
dependent_to.name: xfdesktop

dependent_to.description: xfwm4 is the window manager for Xfce
dependent_to.name: xfwm4

dependent_to.description:
This project provides a consistent, well-structured, frequently
released, open source database of keyboard configuration data. The
project is targeted to XKB-based systems.
dependent_to.name: xkeyboard-config

description:
intltool is a set of tools to centralize translation of many different
file formats using GNU gettext-compatible PO files.
name: intltool

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
